article_title: African Nations Seek Sway Over Oil, Gas Development
article_text:
Ahead of drives to start or expand oil and gas production, several African governments are crafting laws that give them more sway over the energy sector, part of a tide of resource nationalism on the continent.

South Africa, Mozambique, Kenya and Tanzania and other countries are due to either bring new legislation before government for approval this year or start the drafting process. Laws they are considering could raise tax rates,...

article_summary:
Laws they are considering could raise tax rates,...
Ahead of drives to start or expand oil and gas production, several African governments are crafting laws that give them more sway over the energy sector, part of a tide of resource nationalism on the continent.
South Africa, Mozambique, Kenya and Tanzania and other countries are due to either bring new legislation before government for approval this year or start the drafting process.
